meanings.definition: To fill with an excessive number of people or organisms.
meanings.sent1: The small island was overpopulating with tourists during the summer months.
meanings.sent2: The city started overpopulating after the new factory was built nearby.
meanings.sent3: The zoo animals joked that they were overpopulating the enclosures and needed more space.
meanings.sent4: The garden was overpopulating with weeds, choking out the flowers.
meanings.sent5: The ant colony was overpopulating their underground tunnels, causing congestion and chaos.

meanings.definition: To cause an area to become too densely populated.
meanings.sent1: The rapid urbanization was overpopulating the once quiet town.
meanings.sent2: The construction of high-rise buildings was overpopulating the skyline.
meanings.sent3: The library shelves were overpopulating with books, making it hard to find a specific title.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds were overpopulating the sky, threatening to bring heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The traffic was overpopulating the streets, causing gridlock during rush hour.
